title: A serious question to the "live design team".
body:
**Are you ever going to openly talk with us about the last 3 seasons' questionable balance choices and blatantly missed rework marks?** A quick recap, to make myself clear.

-MYMU, mages update: failed. Most of its changes were reverted or reworked a second/third time. _**You didn't try to reach for us to understand what went wrong and what to improve.**_
-Assassins update, failed. Lethality was originally created for a purpose which doesn't exist anymore. Leblanc and Rengar were reverted, many others needed a lot of further work. _**You didn't try to reach for us to understand what went wrong and what to improve.**_
-Mage items update: completely failed to reach the intended goals. _**You didn't try to reach for us to understand what went wrong and what to improve.**_
- Zoe is a balance nightmare.
- Pyke is extremely questionable.
- Neeko (see above).
- Kai'Sa (see above)
- Irelia is a balance nightmare
- Akali is a balance nightmare

Overall, it seems like you're unable to learn from your mistake or to communicate with your community in order to avoid critical mistakes.
I just don't understand. So again:

**Are you ever going to openly talk with us about the last 3 seasons' questionable balance choices and blatantly missed rework marks?**

Both the Assassins and Mid-year-mage updates were done in order to add *some* complexity to what was though as **linear** champions. This means that assassins were given external mechanics (relying on an object that has very the player has *some* influence over) in order to pad their insta-bursts. 

Mages, such as Brand, were given an extra layer of complexity, by adding the 3 stack mechanic to further his explosive and 'fire-spready' nature. They gave Zyra a new passive to help further her 'flourish' with more than just the 2 to 4 plants you could pop out. Etc, etc. 

The Mage item update was to streamline build paths for all mages. EVERYONE wanted to be able to play their favorite champs where they can 1) spam abilities and 2) 1 shot at a high frequency. To achieve this, Morellonomicon was slated and split between the three Lost Chapter items you have today. 

The assassins item updates were also a way to complement most assassins new abilities and mechanics by having them rely on the new stat, Lethality. Not only did it make them strong for building lethality, it also removed one of the most important items from assassins, the Brutilizer. Lethality was also meant as a means to nerf armor pen, for those who stacked as many as they could early game. Armor pen is great early game, but if the player hadn't built plenty of AD, the armor pen loses a lot of value. Lethality set a base line for how much damage any player could expect from an assassin (obviously a fuck ton) but it also meant that assassins couldn't surprise their target with a flat 30 armor pen during level 4 all-ins when their target build a measly 10 armor.

They changed them from "linear" buy items possibly nuke enemy to Buy items nuke enemy. 

What a change!
